Description: Lip and neck sherd (mended from four fragments) with handle root of an East Greek pottery neck-amphora. Orange-buff clay, very micaceous; glaze fired dull orange-brown; interior reserved save top of neck; exterior: top of neck glazed with remains of added colour lines; volute flanking handle; trace of central motif on neck.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.949)
